concise_definition: v. 返回, 归还, 报告, 产生; n. 返回, 回报, 选举结果

definitions.explanation_en: To go or come back to a place, person, or condition, especially the original or starting point.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指回到某个地方、某人或某种状态，尤其是原来的地点或起点。
definitions.example_en: She will return to her hometown next month.

definitions.explanation_en: To give something back to its original owner or place, often after borrowing or receiving it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将借来或收到的东西归还给原主或原处。
definitions.example_en: Please return the book to the library by Friday.
definitions.example_cn: 请在周五之前把书还回图书馆。

definitions.explanation_en: To produce a result, profit, or outcome, especially in financial or measurable terms.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指产生某种结果、利润或收益，尤其在财务或可衡量的方面。
definitions.example_en: The investment returned a 15% profit last year.
definitions.example_cn: 这项投资去年带来了15%的利润。

definitions.explanation_en: To give an answer or response, especially in a formal or official context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指作出答复或回应，尤其在正式或官方语境中。
definitions.example_en: The committee returned a verdict of not guilty.
definitions.example_cn: 委员会作出了无罪的裁决。

definitions.explanation_en: The act of coming or going back; a return journey or trip.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指返回的行为；一次往返旅程。
definitions.example_en: His return from Europe was delayed due to bad weather.
definitions.example_cn: 由于天气恶劣，他从欧洲返回的行程被推迟了。

definitions.explanation_en: The amount of profit or gain received from an investment or activity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指从投资或活动中获得的收益或回报。
definitions.example_en: The stock has a high return over the past five years.
definitions.example_cn: 这只股票在过去五年中回报率很高。

definitions.explanation_en: The official result of an election or vote.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指选举或投票的官方结果。
definitions.example_en: The final return showed a narrow victory for the incumbent.
definitions.example_cn: 最终计票结果显示现任者以微弱优势获胜。

comparison.analysis: “Come back” 是口语化表达，强调动作的“回来”，常用于日常对话，语义较窄，多指物理位置的返回。而 “return” 更正式，适用范围更广，可指物、信息、结果、状态等的回归，具有更强的抽象性和正式性。
“Give back” 强调归还物品或回馈社会，常带有道德或情感色彩，如感恩、报答。而 “return” 更中性，可指法律、商业或程序上的归还，不一定包含情感因素。例如，return a book（还书）是义务，give back a favor（还人情）则含情感义务。
“Revert” (恢复原状) 通常指回到之前的状态或形式，尤其在技术、法律或语言语境中，强调“逆向变化”。它常用于被动或非自愿的回归，如 revert to an old version。而 “return” 更主动，可指有意识地回到某地、某人或某种状态，适用范围更广。
